title: Leck Fischer
text:
Otto Peter Leck Fischer (March 26, 1904 – June 17, 1956) was a <a href="Danes">Danish</a> writer and playwright. He was the brother of the politician <a href="Viggo%20Kampmann">Viggo Kampmann</a>. Fischer was a socially conscious writer that portrayed the modern urban man with a sad, gray everyday life. His literary style was cool and matter-of-fact. Fischer was read and appreciated in his day, but he has since been forgotten (except in literary-history circles), perhaps because he was so closely associated with the time in which he lived and which he portrayed. Fischer made a name for himself in many genres: novels, films, and radio drama. He is buried at <a href="Mariebjerg%20Cemetery">Mariebjerg Cemetery</a> in <a href="Gentofte">Gentofte</a>.
Leck Fischer's plays are held in the theater collection at the <a href="Royal%20Library%2C%20Denmark">Royal Library</a>.
